Job Description

Title: District Clerk

Introduction: This position is that of a district clerk responsible for performing clerical and secretarial duties for the Morton County Soil Conservation District.

Duties and Responsibilities:

1. Serves as a receptionist to the district and NRCS office
2. Assist supervisors with preparation of the annual budget for the district
3. Prepare annual financial report for the office of the State Auditor
4. Prepare external audit requirements as needed
5. Prepare financial report necessary to apply for mill levy
6. Attend all board meetings
7. Prepare monthly report to the district board on activities and accomplishments
8. Assist in preparing agenda for board meetings
9. Send out notice of all board meetings
10. Take minutes at all regular and special meetings
11. Post and distribute required monthly and special meeting minutes and agendas
12. Prepare monthly comprehensive financial statements and reports to be reviewed by the board
13. Maintain adequate records of all receipts and disbursements to be reviewed by the board monthly
14. Keep record of and reimburse supervisors expenses as allowable
15. Prepare bills and checks of expenses to be reviewed and approved by the board
16. Gather and maintain correspondence to be reviewed monthly by the board
17. Answer routine correspondence and handle incoming and outgoing mail
18. Provide communications and correspond with board members as necessary to keep them informed of important district and conservation issues
19. Be able to work proficiently in QuickBooks Pro accounting software; training will be provided
20. Process payroll via direct deposit and paper checks as approved by the board
21. Maintain personnel payroll records
22. File required payroll liabilities and reports
23. Prepare and file W-2 for employees and keep appropriate records
24. Prepare and file 1099 for appropriate Vendors and keep appropriate records
25. Maintain adequate employee records
26. Assist with the preparation of NRCS Reports
27. Coordinate requests for assistance with NRCS and other appropriate resource agencies
28. Gather information and prepare files for conservation plans
29. Determine need for office supplies and order needed materials
30. Work with the District 319 Watershed Coordinator on 319 Vouchers to be filed with ND Department of Health
31. Maintain district property records
32. Prepare annual report and publish in Newsletter
33. Publicize conservation efforts in cooperation with NRCS District Conservationist and other district staff through newsletter articles
34. Assist in gathering information and publishing Achievement Award winner in the district newsletter
35. Participate in the organization of field tours, workshops, educational activities and achievement program
36. Assist in preparing news releases of district activities
37. Make reservations for attendance at training sessions and conventions
38. Attend training sessions when approved by the district board
39. Assist in the planning and preparation for the annual meeting and banquet
40. Maintain the Morton County SCD Website and Facebook Page
41. Review Insurance Programs and advise the district board as needed
42. May be asked to assist with tree planting; some lifting may be required
43. Perform other related duties as requested by the district board of directors

Supervision: This position is the direct responsibility of the board of supervisors. However, other district employees or the NRCS district conservationist in the office may be designated to be directly responsible for the day-to-day duties of this position.

Performance Review: Your performance of each duty in this position will be evaluated against the requirements developed for your position. A formal review will be completed by your supervisor on a yearly basis and will be discussed with you. Your performance rating is an overall evaluation of your performance in the judgment of the District Personnel Committee. It will be the basis for any merit pay increases granted by the district board.

Wages: $20+ DOE

Benefits: Retirement (after 3-month probationary period,) Annual Leave, Sick Leave, Paid Holidays, Paid Individual Health Insurance Program.

Application Deadline: The Morton County SCD will accept applications until the position is filled.

Cardinal Law P.A. is a dedicated personal injury law firm committed to advocating for clients who have been injured due to negligence. We pride ourselves on providing compassionate, expert legal representation and exceptional client service. Job Description
Title: Receptionist
Supervisor: Randy Salas
Department: Administration
FLSA Status: Non-Exempt


Job Overview:
We are seeking a highly organized and customer-focused Receptionist to join our team. As the first point of contact for visitors, clients, and staff, you will play a crucial role in creating a welcoming and professional atmosphere. This position requires strong communication skills, attention to detail, and the ability to manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.


Key Responsibilities:
 * Front Desk Operations: Greet visitors, clients, and employees in a friendly and professional manner. Direct visitors to appropriate personnel or departments and ensure they sign in and out.
 * Phone Management: Answer, screen, and forward incoming calls efficiently, ensuring calls are directed to the correct person or department. Take and relay messages as necessary.
 * Administrative Support: Perform clerical duties such as filing, photocopying, scanning, and faxing. Assist with scheduling meetings, appointments, and conferences when needed.
 * Mail and Deliveries: Sort and distribute incoming mail, packages, and deliveries. Ensure outgoing mail is sent in a timely manner.
 * Office Supplies and Maintenance: Maintain and order office supplies as needed. Ensure the front desk and lobby area are neat, tidy, and well-organized.
 * Visitor Management: Ensure all visitors follow proper security protocols and maintain visitor logs.
 * Collaboration with Other Departments: Provide general administrative support to various departments and assist with special projects as required.
 * Database Management: Maintain and update contact information and assist with data entry and other administrative tasks as required.



Key Qualifications:
 * High school diploma or equivalent preferred
 * Previous experience in a receptionist, administrative, or customer service role is a plus.
 * Experience with office equipment (e.g., phones, fax machines, copiers) and Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook).

Skills:
 * Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
 * Strong organizational and time-management abilities.
 * Ability to multitask and remain calm in a fast-paced environment.
 * Customer-oriented with a professional demeanor and appearance.
 * Ability to work independently as well as part of a team.

Attributes:
 * Positive attitude, friendly, and approachable.
 * Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
 * Dependable and punctual.



Supervisory Responsibility
This role carries no supervisory responsibilities.


Work Environment
 * The role is based in a modern office environment with a designated workspace and access to necessary equipment like computers, phones, and technology.



Physical Demands
 * Ability to sit for extended periods, answer phones, and greet visitors. Some light lifting may be required (e.g., office supplies, mail).



Work Schedule
The standard hours of operation are Monday through Friday, from 8:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.


Travel
There is no travel required for this position.


As per Executive Order 11246 Section 503, & VEVRAA: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

About Us

SugaringNYC is the #1 fastest-growing beauty franchise in the U.S., with 120+ locations nationwide and counting. We specialize in organic body waxing using a proprietary sugar paste and pride ourselves on delivering exceptional service in a modern, eco-conscious environment.

At our Boston studio, we are building a high-performing and supportive team that values professionalism, positive energy, and client satisfaction. We are now hiring a Front Desk Receptionist — the face of our studio and the first impression for every guest.

What You Will Get

Hourly pay: $17/hour + weekly performance bonuses

Weekly payments

Free & discounted services and products – enjoy the perks

Flexible scheduling – both full-time and part-time options

Paid Time Off (PTO) after the trial period

Career path – grow into Assistant Manager or Salon Manager roles within 1–2 years

All training provided – we will teach you everything

Supportive team environment – you’ll be heard and valued

Ready to Be the Face of Our Studio?

If you’re looking for a stable, friendly, and fast-growing company where your work matters — SugaringNYC is the place for you. We invest in our people, offer real growth, and always recognize great performance.

Apply today and join our Boston team!

PromptMed Urgent Care is currently seeking one bilingual Front Desk Receptionists (FDR) in the company’s urgent care center located in Waukegan, Illinois. The FDR will typically work 4 scheduled shifts a week, rotating 12, 8 and 6-hour shifts among FDRs (including a fair share of evening, weekend and holiday shifts). This opportunity affords working in a brand new, fully-equipped urgent care medical facility.

COMPANY:

PromptMed Urgent Care is a premier, fast-growing independent operator of neighborhood walk-in medical clinics located in Lake County, IL. PromptMed delivers high-quality, timely and affordable care in a convenient setting for those seeking immediate medical treatment for sudden illness or injury. The Company operates a fully-equipped, state-of-the-art licensed medical facility, utilizing the latest procedures and technologies, and is open Monday-Friday from 8:00am-8:00pm, and Saturday/Sunday from 9:00am-5:00pm, 363 days/year.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

 * Greet patients in a professional and courteous manner both in person and over the phone.
 * Clearly explain what is needed at the time of check-in such as completion of required paperwork.
 * Clearly explain what is needed at the time of check-out such as follow up paperwork, out of pocket expenses, co-pays or balances.
 * Verify insurance and patient contact information is accurate prior to patient being seen by the provider.
 * Verify, update, and scan pertinent insurance and personal information, such as driver’s license or ID, insurance card and other required documents.
 * Accurately enter patient information data into the computer system.
 * Reconcile all payment transactions (cash, credit card and checks) at end of each day and provide to a manager for approval.
 * Prepare intake packets for patients.
 * Monitor drug screen results for patients, distribute to employer or patient and research any missing results.
 * Complete accurate charge entry based on the medical records for self pay patients and collect payment at the time of service.
 * Assist patients with questions and get assistance from others as needed.
 * Protect the security of medical records to ensure confidentiality is maintained in compliance with office procedures and regulatory agencies.
 * If patient in the waiting room shows life threatening symptoms, alert a provider immediately.
 * Keep waiting areas clean and orderly.
 * Maintain coffee bar and refreshment area, ensuring that the area is well stocked, fresh and clean.
 * Must work early and late shifts as needed and self-coordinate for any absences.
 * Maintain adequate supply of patient forms including medical release forms, HIPAA compliance etc.
 * Assist in cleaning and prepping exam rooms as needed.
 * Clean the lobby bathroom daily.
 * Perform all other duties as assigned.

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:

 * High school graduate or equivalent required.
 * 1-2 years experience in any customer service/relations position preferred.
 * Excellent people skills and a positive attitude/personality.
 * Maintain an excellent work ethic and be able to thrive in an entrepreneurial environment.

REQUIRED SKILLS:

 * Ability to work effectively as part of a team and individually with little supervision and instruction.
 * Sense of urgency in addressing patients and working with staff within all areas of the organization.
 * Excellent interpersonal skills to effectively and courteously collaborate with patients and families, management, clinical staff and physicians.
 * Knowledge of computer functions and ability to navigate electronic medical record system.
 * Organizational skills necessary to maintain efficient workflow.
 * Ability to maintain strict confidentiality of sensitive patient and employer information.
 * Ability to adjust responsibilities to accommodate a fast-paced work environment while maintaining excellent customer service and staff interaction.
 * Ability to communicate effectively in Spanish and English, both verbally and written.

COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS:

For full-time employees, we offer:

 * Competitive hourly wage with perks and bonuses;
 * Generous benefits package, including: medical, dental, vision insurance, childcare FSA, 401(k) match, uniform allowance, parental leave, vacation/PTO;
 * Opportunity for continued growth as we expand.

 * Answers phones according to facility policy, takes and relays messages for managers and staff. Screens calls.

EXPECTATIONS



 * Demonstrates and maintains a positive, professional manner, manages time efficiently and effectively, provides leadership as a role model to promote a team approach, collaborates and participates in policy creation and appropriate problem-solving methods.

 * With respect to Resident Rights, ensures all care is provided with respect and dignity for the residents/clients, their families and the staff. Reports all complaints made by residents/clients and/or families to the appropriate supervisors, reports all allegations of abuse, misappropriation of funds/resident property and/or any other corporate compliance, drug free workplace, safe work practices, all federal, state and local regulations and laws.



 * Completes all annual education requirements timely, including but not limited to Compliance, Privacy, Security and HIPAA training and exhibits behavior as set forth by the Code of Conduct in the performance of their duties.



 * Performs other duties as assigned.




JOB SPECIFICATION SHEET



Education: Must have high school diploma or equivalent.



Experience: 6 months of general office work required with a focus on customer service.



Skills: Must have good working computer skills with basic professional computer software (Microsoft Office suite, Windows, etc.) and the capacity for learning new software systems quickly. Must be self-directed with excellent organizational skills and the ability to manage tasks and assignments concurrently. Must have strong motivational skills and a high emotional intelligence quotient (EQ)

job_description:
We are looking for a Receptionist to manage our front desk on a daily basis and to perform a variety of administrative and clerical tasks. As a Receptionist, you will be the first point of contact for our company. Our Receptionist’s duties include offering administrative support across the organization. You will welcome guests and greet people who visit the business. You will coordinate front-desk activities, including distributing correspondence and redirecting phone calls. To be successful as a Receptionist, you should have a pleasant personality, as this is also a customer service role. job_description:
Job Title: Front Office Staff (Full/Part-Time)

Location: Bozeman, MT

Company: Foundation Therapy Services

About Us: Foundation Therapy Services is a pediatric clinic offering speech-language and occupational therapy located in beautiful Bozeman, MT. We are proud to have been awarded the Woman-Owned Business of the Year for the State of Montana by the Small Business Administration in 2022. As we continue to grow, we are expanding our team to support our new clinic, opening in April 2025. We are looking for a proactive, self-motivated front office staff member to join our dynamic multidisciplinary team of clinicians who work together to provide therapy services to pediatric and young adult populations.

Position Overview:

We are seeking a friendly, organized, and dependable individual to join our front office team. In this role, you will be responsible for ensuring smooth office operations, managing patient appointments, and providing exceptional service to our clients and visitors. This is an excellent opportunity to be part of a growing small business with a collaborative work environment.

Job Type:

 * Full-time or Part-time (32-40 hours per week)

 * Monday to Friday, between 8:00 AM and 5:00 PM

 * In-office position (no travel required)

Key Responsibilities:

 * Oversee general front office operations, ensuring smooth day-to-day functioning.

 * Greet visitors, answer phone calls, and provide exceptional customer service to clients.

 * Coordinate patient appointments and manage clinician schedules.

 * Communicate with referral sources (doctors, dentists, clinics) and insurance companies to

coordinate patient care, benefits, and documentation.

 * Maintain office efficiency by organizing office operations and procedures, including

preparing payroll, managing correspondence, and establishing filing systems.

 * Assist in onboarding new employees.

 * Help prepare for regular staff meetings and provide administrative support to the therapy

team.

Required Qualifications:

 * High school diploma or GED (associate degree or higher preferred).

 * At least 1-2 years of experience as Front Office Staff or Administrative Assistant, with a

focus on managing schedules and improving office processes.

 * Proficient in office software, including Microsoft Office Suite, email tools, spreadsheets,

databases, and Electronic Medical Record (EMR) software.

 * Excellent computer skills and the ability to quickly learn new systems.

 * Organized, detail-oriented, and able to multitask.

 * Strong time management and communication skills, both written and verbal.

 * Ability to handle confidential information with professionalism and discretion.

Preferred Qualifications:

 * Experience in developing and optimizing internal systems.

 * Creative problem-solving skills and a keen eye for areas of improvement.

 * Team-building experience and an engaging personality.

 * Strong positive outlook and the ability to maintain a friendly work environment.

How to Apply:

If you are a motivated individual who is passionate about working in a supportive and growth-focused environment, we encourage you to apply! Please submit your resume, including two professional references, to angie@foundationtherapyservices.com.

Foundation Therapy Services Offers Full-Time Employees:

 * Competitive pay, based on experience

 * Employee (W2) status

 * Medical, dental, and vision insurance options

 * Matching retirement plan (after 1 year, vested after 5 years)

 * Meaningful work-life balance with flexible scheduling

 * Professional development assistance

 * Opportunities for growth in areas of interest

We look forward to learning more about you and welcoming you to our team!

*The position will remain open until filled.

job_description:
STATEMENT OF JOB:

The concierge/receptionist performs a variety of administrative support duties including: greeting all visitors to the community, answering the telephone, transferring calls to appropriate party, and taking accurate messages. Monitors walkie-talkie, door security system and fire panel as needed. Monitors resident sign-in and sign-out log and the visitor registration log and completes administrative support functions such as filing and making copies.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

Policies/Procedures/Administration

 * Transfers calls or takes messages as appropriate in a courteous, friendly and helpful manner
 * Fills out and logs service request forms for residents and/or staff
 * Monitors and greets visitors to the community
 * Keeps front desk and lobby area clean and neat at all times
 * Sells meal tickets and accounts for by payroll deduction or personal check
 * Ensure the security of the building; Monitors resident sign-in and sign-out log and the visitor registration log; periodically checks entrances/exits of the building to ensure community is secure
 * Attends in-services and staff meetings as required
 * Completes all other duties as assigned

Requirements:

Residents

 * Assists with coordinating van schedule for residents
 * Follows confidentiality policies regarding release of resident information

Staff

 * Performs supportive office functions for all departments including filing, typing, and making copies

Requirements:

 * Must possess a high school diploma or GED
 * Must be considerate, neat, well groomed and professional in appearance. Must dress in a professional manner
 * Must have experience in Administration functions
 * Must answer phones in a polite and professional manner
 * Must be organized, and able to work well with others as part of a team
 * Must be polite and considerate to residents, visitors, co-workers and management team
 * Must be able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing
 * Must be able to sit for extended periods of time
 * Must be able to function effectively in a busy environment and be able to multi-task
 * Must be willing to work a flexible schedule that includes weekends and holidays
 * Must attend all required in-services and staff meetings
